trends: There have been 20 other sightings in Santa Fe
There were no other sightings in Santa Fe on or around May 19th 1966
divs: Sighting DetailsI was alone in my car, driving from Santa Fe down to Albuquerque. The highway is very straight for miles. The sun was shining with hardly a cloud in the sky. Somewhere between Santa Fe & Albuquerque something caught my eye as the reflection of the sun bounced off this object. I looked up and don't recall seeing a super giant blimp, but there it was. It was maybe 20 times larger than any blimp I ever saw and it was hovering about 2000' over the highway towards the east from my position. I watched in amazement this huge silvery blimp. I recall not seeing what I call the undercarriage where people ride in blimps, which was odd. I watched it for several minutes. The highway was virtually empty so I was able to watch it while driving about 55 mph going straight. Suddenly it began to turn in place while it hovered. As it turned in place, which I watched, it disappeared before my eyes. When I got back to Highlands University in Las Vegas later that day, I mentioned the incident to one of my roommates, Greg Goodpasture. Greg told me that his dad was a General in the Army and was involved in the famous crash at Roswell 19 years earlier. Greg suggested it might have been a UFO which seemed plausible. He told me to keep my eyes out for more as there were many UFO sightings in the area. I remember beliving in their existance, but seeing one, confirmed it for me in my bones. I have always been afraid to file such reports, fearing who or what might want to interact with me. I'm not sure if I filed this report in the past, but I no longer fear the result.
Summary: saw object hovering & turning. As it turned it disappeared as I watched.
